definitions.definition: To make a ruffle in; to curl or flute , as an edge of fabric.
examples: Ruffle the end of the cuff.

definitions.definition: To disturb ; especially, to cause to flutter .
examples: Her sudden volley of insults ruffled his composure.

definitions.definition: To grow rough, boisterous, or turbulent.
To become disordered; to play loosely; to flutter.
To be rough; to jar; to be in contention; hence, to put on airs; to swagger.
To make into a ruff; to draw or contract into puckers, plaits, or folds; to wrinkle.
To erect in a ruff, as feathers.
To beat with the ruff or ruffle, as a drum.
To throw together in a disorderly manner.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To make a ruffle in; to curl or flute , as an edge of fabric.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To disturb ; especially, to cause to flutter .
( intransitive ) To grow rough, boisterous, or turbulent.
( intransitive ) To become disordered; to play loosely; to flutter.
( intransitive ) To be rough; to jar; to be in contention; hence, to put on airs; to swagger.
To make into a ruff; to draw or contract into puckers, plaits, or folds; to wrinkle.
To erect in a ruff, as feathers.
( military ) To beat with the ruff or ruffle, as a drum.
To throw together in a disorderly manner.
